page.title: 16A VILLAGE MUM'S DAY - 4
page.content: It's tea time, the school is cleaned, the girls and I are having our salad before Brownies start. My older daughter, Jodi, and I get into our uniforms and try to remember everything we need to take to the village hall where we hold our meetings. My younger daughter goes to a friend because my husband is away on a course. Sometimes she comes to Brownies with me, though she is only 5, but tonight the District Commissioner is coming so we all have to be on our best behaviour. It's 6 o'clock but not all of the Brownies have arrived. Perhaps the warm weather is keeping them out at play. Tonight we are going to make "Good Turn Hands" which are made like dancing dolls. After clearing up and locking the Village hall its time for home. Several girls walk with me.
